actions.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure.

actions.committee: Committee on Government Reform and Oversight, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned
actions.text: Referred to the Committee on Government Reform and Oversight, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to House Government Reform and Oversight
Referred to House Judiciary

actions.subcommittee: National Security, International Affairs and Criminal Justice
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Security, International Affairs and Criminal Justice.

actions.in_subcommittee: National Security, International Affairs and Criminal Justice
actions.text: Subcommittee Hearings Held.

actions.in_subcommittee: National Security, International Affairs and Criminal Justice
actions.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_subcommittee: National Security, International Affairs and Criminal Justice
actions.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Reported by the Committee on Government Reform. H. Rept. 105-138, Part I.
House Committee on Judiciary Granted an extension for further consideration ending not later than June 20, 1997.
Committee on Judiciary discharged.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 78.
Mr. Sessions moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.
Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.
Cleared for White House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 105-25.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on National Security, International Affairs and Criminal Justice

official_title: To amend the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Collection Act of 1992 to extend the authorization of the Assassination Records Review Board until September 30, 1998.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Amends the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Collection Act of 1992 to: (1) extend the termination date of the Assassination Records Review Board until September 30, 1998; and (2) authorize appropriations for FY 1998.

titles.title: To amend the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Collection Act of 1992 to extend the authorization of the Assassination Records Review Board until September 30, 1998.
